title: No outgoing SMTP and now incoming no pop 3 also
content: No emails from Thunderbird for 5 days. I can get email from webmail at Wowway. This does not let Thunderbird off the hook. Can I get some support from Thunderbird? Firefox works fine as does every program on my desktop PC. Can I get some support? Please respond or I will be uninstalling your little not very robust app. Thanks a bunch. Since I have asked for support earlier this week, and I have received none, loet me try to incentivize you with a $20.00 donation to Thunderbird. Is Thunderbird still part of the Mozilla foundation? I want an email (pop3) that works. Please. Thank you in advance for your kind cooperation...

title: Modifica disposizione predefinita colonne mail
content: Buongiorno, la disposizione predefinita delle colonne delle mail non mi piace e quindi ne ho creata una che soddisfa maggiormente le mie necessità. Ogni volta che creo una nuova cartella, questa viene creata con la disposizione predefinita e devo quindi modificarla come vs articolo legata alla "copia visualizzazione". Questo processo però è estremamente lungo perché di cartelle ne creo moltissime e devo ricordarmi ogni volta di fare questo passaggio. Vorrei quindi sapere come fare a memorizzare la mia versione di disposizione delle colonne in modo che diventi il default per ogni singola nuova cartella; ho già cambiato l'ordinamento in base alla data modificando la relativa voce nel registro di configurazione ma non riesco a capire qual'è la voce relativa alle colonne da visualizzare?!?!?!? Già che ci siamo vorrei anche sapere come impostare, per default, che le mail NON devono mai essere raggruppate (in modo da non dover agire su ogni singola cartella) e come applicarlo al volo a tutte le cartelle già esistenti. Ringrazio anticipatamente per le risposte, Riccardo
creator: RikyTo

title: Incoming server already exists
content: I have been using Thunderbird for many years. I have a large number of email accounts added. I recently tried to add another one and received the error message: 'Incoming server already exists'. I eventually uninstalled and deleted the whole thing and downloaded another version which I installed. Although I had deleted all mentions of Thunderbird from my computer, it stills comes up with the same message. If I create an account without the password, it will accept it but then doesn't recognise the password, despite the account working on other devices.
creator: mike597

title: Thunderbird Email Signatures
content: This is a Wish List item but I can't locate where to place it ;-) On the basis that I have Folders for Companies and Individuals based on their email addresses, I require different signatures for each Folder. This was a feature in the Virtual Access email software, where when a folder was the 'active' or highlighted folder, you used the 'Signature' icon or menu option, whereby you created the 'Signature' for that particular folder. So for my friends my signature was 'All best, Jonathon' or for my family 'Love, Dad' or 'Love, Jonathon' for acquaintances or companies, a signature that included my address and contact numbers.
creator: TheFlapjack

title: Does remove message data affects the mail server?
content:
Hi,

Just want to ask, we are doing a backup on our emails in Thunderbird using IMAP settings. We wanted an individual backup of each user and do the manual backup by downloading all emails and zip the Profiles folder.

In every user that we added, we needed to remove each in order to create a new one. Before deleting the said user, there is a check box that says Remove Message Data. We check this checkbox. Just want to clarify that deleting the message data doesn't mean it affects whatever we had in the mail server, right? It is only being deleted in Thunderbird locally right?

Thank you.
creator: milkylorejo

title: Missing folders after re-installation
content: Hello, I was hoping someone here might be able to help. I've had to re-install Thunderbird on a Windows desktop computer (likely after the machine had been formatted and Windows re-installed), and set up again two email accounts. I've also brought back the Thunderbird profile from a backup. Yet, several folders that existed before are no longer there -- including the Sent folder under one of the accounts, a Gmail one. I'm not sure whether the missing folders were under that Gmail account, or rather local folders, but I assume that either way they would be in the backed up profile. What can I do to resurrect those missing folders? Thank you in advance.

title: Thunderbird and MailFence Config Doesn't Cooperate
content:
In my ongoing effort to divorce myself from all things Google, I have installed Thunderbird and acquired a MailFence email address. Today I finally got around to getting things configured, but I'm at all stop for now. This I cannot unravel. Loaded Thunderbird

Config T'bird for my old Gmail account - all ok, retrieving email headers and designed. All working fine.

Entered mailfence address and password into the "Add Email Account" and hit enter

Thunderbird responds with the "found auto config" text or words to that effect. - All Green - Hit Enter

Server responds with there's a problem with username and password

Ok. I go to Firefox and easily login to my Mailfence email account using the same account info that I tried to use with IMAP server...no problems.

Account info works fine for the WebMail service and fails for the IMAP service.

Now I'm really scratching my head; do the Mailfence webmail and IMAP servers use different account info? 

Help
creator: LOHPLT18

title: Recover Private Folders, Contacts
content:
My Windows 10 PC has experienced a Blue Screen error and I can't load Windows. I have been able to access and transfer my perspnal data, but not my applications. So while I have recovered everything else, I need to recover my Thunderbird Private Folders and Contacts. Accessing my data is hard enough when Windows is running (what I view as a major design shortcoming in Thunderbird) but I cannot see how to access it when Windows won't load.

I have been able to set up a new PC with all my data and have reinstalled my applications, but of course the new copy of Thunderbird knows nothing of my Private Folders and Contacts from my old PC. The transfer was done by copying my data from the old PC's SSD to a new PC's SSD. But I can't find a way to copy the thunderbird program with my embedded folders and contacts.

Help please?

(And Developers, please find a better way to store, backup and recover Private Folders, Contacts and other personal data)
creator: graeme.hurst16

title: Emails sent from one gmail acct are seen by receivers of those emails as coming from a different gmail account
content:
Hello, I have multiple gmail accounts and use T-Bird as my client for all of them.

For the last couple of months, when I send an email from my main account the receiver of the email sees it as coming from a different gmail account. When they respond, that response winds up in the inbox of the different account (ie the account that they see as being the source of the email).

Can you help me with this?

Best, Bill Vedder

title: Need configuration help
content:
Hi,

Background: I've been using PC since the early 80s and am pretty comfortable w/ a lot of tech, but I'm very much a novice Thunderbird user having only used it few times to help out someone as described below.

I'm trying to help someone via Teamviewer who uses Thunderbird and about every ~6 months unknowingly modifies it in a way that annoys him and/or causes it to not work, etc. I can get Thunderbird back to being able to send and receive email and a few other things, but I can't get his contacts to show up in the sidebar which he really likes, put the folders in the sidebar in the right order, figure out why the gmail folder is in the sidebar, etc. Is there a way to skip gmail and just use Thunderbird (Mozilla?) for email?

I'm willing to pay a consultant.

Please help.

Thanks!
creator: SumoBot

title: Thunderbird - New install
content:
Am trying to install Thunderbird, for the first time. Cant get it to do anything. Tell me my settings are incorrect.. Am using ATT.net for email. Web mail works fine. OUTLOOK that came with WIN10, has got so it no longer will receive emails reliably. Loads very few anymore. Was looking to try something different... .. Settings I have found on the ATT mail account that is suppose to work - doesnt.... What I have used: . Mail settings pop3 inbound port SSL outbound out port inbound.att.net 995 yes outbound.att.net 465 IMAP imap.mail.att.net 993 yes smtp.mail.att.net 465 or 587 .... some OLD settings I also found and tried.... 

 in:  imap.mail.att.net                    pop.att.yahoo.com          port 995 out:  smtp.mail.att.net                   smtp.att.yahoo.com                465

. I have used everyone of these, and Thunderbird just tells me a setting/user name/password isnt correct... Well, user and PW is correct, as it IS what I am using to log onto the web mail... . Have also tried the IMPORT selection. 

   Outlook.. but says there is NO association to am email app.  But, best i can tell, settings shows  MAIL under the DEFAULT.. dont actually say OUTLOOK, but is what came with WIN10, and I have been using.. till it kinda quit a few months ago.

... Thoughs? Thanks..
creator: batsintheatic

title: How do I export contacts to an LDIP file? UPDATE - Never mind
content:
Apparently there's no way I can delete this. I just updated to 102.7.0 and tried to access the address book, and it's working.

My contact list will not accept edits or additions. I found an article describing how to fix it at https://support.mozilla.org/bm/questions/1370420#answer-1488581

The solution given requires that I export my address book as an LDIF file as the first step. A Google search reveals numerous suggestions to select the address book, then go to Tools -> Export to export it. This doesn't work. The only option is to export everything to a zip file. I tried that, and got a corrupted .zip, so I couldn't look to see if there was an LDIF file there.

Help?
